citations.narrative:
The facility does not have up to date acquisition and disposition records. There are still no records regarding births or
deaths of degus since their arrival to the facility. Records indicate a total of 30 degus, but on inspection there were only 23
degus counted and the facility representative acknowledged that recordings of births and deaths have not been kept up
with due to the difficult nature of counting the animals present since they have access to tunnels and burrows. There is no
record of the acquisition of three pigeons or the disposition of nine chickens from the facility. Accurate records of animals
on hand, including acquisitions and dispositions (purchases/births and sales/deaths) are necessary to assess the health
and wellbeing of the animals on site and allow tracking of animals being used for regulatory purposes. Correct by
ensuring the inventory of all animals on hand is up to date and all acquisitions and dispositions are being recorded
including animals born on site or any deaths.
Correct by 30 September 2025.

The facility's refrigerator that stores perishable items is not protecting the food against contamination. Inside the fridge
there is a bag of thawed meat in a plastic bin that is sitting in red to pink liquid. There is also accumulations of water on
the bottom floor of the fridge and on the door. A moldy lemon was present in the door of the fridge upon opening it. Both
the refrigerator and freezer are difficult to close correctly to maintain a seal and there is a lot of built up ice in the freezer.
Liquid coming from the freezer or thawed meat juices can lead to deterioration or contamination of the food.
Contaminated food can lead to decreased food consumption or illness in the animals. Correct by making sure all supplies
of food are stored in facilities which adequately protect such supplies against deterioration, molding, or contamination by
vermin.
Correct by 19 September 2025

There are accumulations of moldy food, in two fox enclosures, the African Crested Porcupine enclosure, and a degu
enclosure. New food has been placed on top of older, moldy food without removing the food waste. Moldy food can lead
to decreased food consumption or illness in the animals. Correct by ensuring all food is wholesome, palatable, and free
from contamination to maintain all animals in good health.
Correct by 19 September 2025.

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
Several enclosures are not being cleaned frequently enough to remove food waste or prevent soiling of the birds within.
Four enclosures housing a total of eight pigeons are not being cleaned frequently enough to prevent the soiling of the
birds within. The feathers around the feet of the birds have areas of contamination with fecal material along with large
portions of the floor. Additionally, an enclosure with a Cape Barren Goose has food waste that has not been removed,
leaving behind moldy food. Accumulation of food waste and feces can lead to increased disease hazards or illnesses.
Correct by ensuring excreta and food waste is removed from primary enclosures and from under and around primary
enclosures as often as necessary to prevent excessive accumulation of feces and food waste, to prevent soiling of the
birds contained in the primary enclosures, and to reduce disease hazards, insects, pests, and odors. The facility took
measures to correct the pigeons at the time of the inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The facility does not have up to date acquisition and disposition records. There are still no records regarding births or 
deaths of degus since their arrival to the facility. Records indicate a total of 30 degus, but on inspection there were only 23 
degus counted and the facility representative acknowledged that recordings of births and deaths have not been kept up 
with due to the difficult nature of counting the animals present since they have access to tunnels and burrows. There is no 
record of the acquisition of three pigeons or the disposition of nine chickens from the facility. Accurate records of animals 
on hand, including acquisitions and dispositions (purchases/births and sales/deaths) are necessary to assess the health 
and wellbeing of the animals on site and allow tracking of animals being used for regulatory purposes. Correct by 
ensuring the inventory of all animals on hand is up to date and all acquisitions and dispositions are being recorded 
including animals born on site or any deaths. 
Correct by 30 September 2025. 
3.125(c) 
   
Facilities, general. 
The facility's refrigerator that stores perishable items is not protecting the food against contamination. Inside the fridge 
there is a bag of thawed meat in a plastic bin that is sitting in red to pink liquid. There is also accumulations of water on 
the bottom floor of the fridge and on the door. A moldy lemon was present in the door of the fridge upon opening it. Both 
the refrigerator and freezer are difficult to close correctly to maintain a seal and there is a lot of built up ice in the freezer. 
Liquid coming from the freezer or thawed meat juices can lead to deterioration or contamination of the food. 
Contaminated food can lead to decreased food consumption or illness in the animals. Correct by making sure all supplies 
of food are stored in facilities which adequately protect such supplies against deterioration, molding, or contamination by 
vermin. 
Correct by 19 September 2025 
3.129(a) 
   
Feeding. 
There are accumulations of moldy food, in two fox enclosures, the African Crested Porcupine enclosure, and a degu 
enclosure. New food has been placed on top of older, moldy food without removing the food waste. Moldy food can lead 
to decreased food consumption or illness in the animals. Correct by ensuring all food is wholesome, palatable, and free

from contamination to maintain all animals in good health. 
Correct by 19 September 2025. 
3.158(a)(1)  Repeat
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
Several enclosures are not being cleaned frequently enough to remove food waste or prevent soiling of the birds within. 
Four enclosures housing a total of eight pigeons are not being cleaned frequently enough to prevent the soiling of the 
birds within. The feathers around the feet of the birds have areas of contamination with fecal material along with large 
portions of the floor. Additionally, an enclosure with a Cape Barren Goose has food waste that has not been removed, 
leaving behind moldy food. Accumulation of food waste and feces can lead to increased disease hazards or illnesses. 
Correct by ensuring excreta and food waste is removed from primary enclosures and from under and around primary 
enclosures as often as necessary to prevent excessive accumulation of feces and food waste, to prevent soiling of the 
birds contained in the primary enclosures, and to reduce disease hazards, insects, pests, and odors. The facility took 
measures to correct the pigeons at the time of the inspection. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
